title: [GAMEPLAY] So its been over a Year, and TF's W can still pass through Yasuo's windwall.

embed.description: This video is regarding the Yasuo Windwall's interaction with Railed click to Cast Abilities such as TF Stun Card.

body: This bug happens nearly every game i play against twisted Fate, i would have though after the projectile change that they would have fixed it but apparently not, its extremely annoying how inconsistent it is. Yasuo in general should be a good counter to TF ( high mobility, ability to block projectiles etc.) but this bug just makes it unfair and really annoying to play against TF, especially when trades or kills are completely decided by wehther or not your windwall felt like blocking a projectile. its been a year Riot, please fix this

replies.body: Windwall is such a poorly made ability with no reasoning behind what goes through it or not.

If it's a non-creature object with a travel speed, then it's a projectile. Wind wall/Unbreakable block projectiles.

The only exceptions are projectiles that go off-screen and Nautilus ultimate.

1) Non-creature objects with travel speeds are stopped by windwall

2) if it goes off screen it gets a pass... 

3) Naut ult is an exception. 

So creature objects should get through? ones like... 
maokai sapling
fizz chum the waters
azir soldiers
zed living shadow
hecarim ult ghosts
...because they don't.

Non creature objects that have travel speeds (and don't go off screen) that should be stopped like ...
syndra toss
ekko parallel convergence 
... but they don't.

Or that ground based projectiles get stopped like ... 
Aatrox's blades of torment
braum's glacial fissure
Naut rip tide
Zyra grasping roots
Poppies new ult
Naut Depth charge \* (the listed exception) 
VelKoz Tectonic disruption \* (also an exception, the visuals are destroyed but the ability goes through) 
... as long as you remember the exceptions.

It's ok, item projectiles are all blocked like ...
mikails crucible
talisman
fotm passive
botrk active \*
... one of these things is not like the other. 

At least ranged auto attacks are consistent being blocked ...
Azir soldiers
Kayle after using  Righteous fury
Thresh
Vel'Koz 
Viktor after firing Siphon Power
TF pick a card empowered attacks (only some of them i think) 
... but they don't. I can almost understand Thresh and Vel because their attacks are part of them, but then Zyra would need an exception too because her AA are her whipping her vines on her hands and drawing them back just like them. 

But effects with no travel time get through consistently ...
Lee Sin cripple (Cripple is a point blank autotargeted debuff)
lulu whimsy (a zero travel time targeted ability) 
...with a few exceptions.

Champions are allowed through...
blitz grab
tahm tongue 
...but i guess not all parts of all champions are created equally. 

At least when orianna ball interacts with windwall it always does the same thing. it stops there. except if you try to move it through windwall it stops and drops, but if you try to shield an ally and the ball hits the windwall the ball immediately returns to ori because of course it does. 

Speaking of player summoned units like ori ball, olaf axe is stopped in place, while thresh lantern is destroyed. Why the difference here? 

The exceptions to this ability know no bounds. 

Meanwhile braum shield works by its own set of rules entirely where AOE effects still hit braum and his nearby allies, projectiles are no longer projectiles for his shield... 
Lux shield
Draven axes
Leona zenith blade 
Jinx rockets (first one damage mitigation but gets full AOE anyway) 
Nami bubble
Cass miasma
Mundo cleavers
... why are these no longer projectiles? 

But Braum shield does block non projectiles like... 
VelKoz Ult
Lux Ult
Cho Rupture (blocked from center of ability not from cho) 
... why? Who knows? 

With your three simple rules and all these exceptions memorized you too can understand what "projectiles" are, but remember, they are different for different walls.

EDIT: formatting + links for reference - 
http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Yasuo/Projectiles
http://leagueoflegends.wikia.com/wiki/Braum
Vel'koz's E goes through windwalls? Did not know that. I thought the spell just stopped since the visuals disappear.

> The following projectiles are bugged and will bypass Wind Wall: Vel'Koz's Tectonic Disruption (the visual effect is destroyed, but the ability will still happen as normal) 

Yup, from the wiki (adjusted for formatting).
{{champion:161}}  laser beam gives no F's
Stopped by Braum shield though.
No travel speed, so indeed.
And under, apparently.

Actually, they tried to appeal to logic as much as possible. If it looks like it _should_ be blocked by the wall, it will most likely be blocked by the wall. I mean, why else would you think his wall is supposed to block the gold card? Because it _looks_ like it should. Obviously this is a bug that should be fixed.

In the video, i looked at it and i saw that the wind wall was not even halfway extended yet so im not sure if that is entirely a bug.

[edit] kk nvm i looked it up and there is a projectile invincibility time so this must be a bug. The only way for the card to hit is if yasuo did not wind wall before he got hit. SO yeah, as a Yasuo main, this is going to give me hell. Also while we are at it. Yasuo cannot blink to Poppy when she uses her w. idk why but apparently the ult blink counts as a dash and i could not ult her. SHE HAD LIKE 180 HEALTH LEFT TOO!

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/bug-report/iAHQz0GW-gameplay-so-its-been-over-a-year-and-tfs-w-can-still-pass-through-yasuos-windwall?comment=000000010001

The problem is not just TF's gold card.
Can this feature apply to skillshots too please riot?
Yeah iv'e seen it happen rarely on other occasions, but it literally happens at least once every game against a TF

TF main here, never seen this before. I have seen Yasuos that used windwall too late(meaning the projectile is past the point where a windwall would stop it) but I've never hit a Yasuo when he windwalled my gold card.

> [{quoted}](name=TsunamiWave22,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=iAHQz0GW,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2015-12-08T02:31:46.504+0000)
>
> TF main here, never seen this before. I have seen Yasuos that used windwall too late(meaning the projectile is past the point where a windwall would stop it) but I've never hit a Yasuo when he windwalled my gold card.

It is never too late for Yasuo's windwall to cancel a projectile unless it has already hit him.
Thanks a lot for the report and the concise explanation / video. Gonna look into this!
Please take your time - in fact, work as slowly and carefully as possible.  You wanna make sure you have this straightened out right?

You should try to reproduce the bug. Like, **a lot.**

Just to make sure.

Can you review the rules by which Yasuo windwall works please. I've left a somewhat sarcastic comment above, listing some of the silly exceptions to the rules but please don't let my sarcasm deter you from improving the clarity around this ability.

Hi.

Can we have the time on when the "Vayne being able to Q through J4's wall" be fixed?
Im pretty sure Riven's Q used to be able to pass through his Ult too, might still be the case, but i though they had fixed those bugs.
Thanks for looking into this, i know the video doesn't show it, but there are allot of other niche scenarios that allow projectiles to pass through the wall.

> [{quoted}](name=Pyromatic,realm=EUW,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=iAHQz0GW,comment-id=00090003,timestamp=2015-12-08T13:33:30.412+0000)
>
> Thanks for looking into this, i know the video doesn't show it, but there are allot of other niche scenarios that allow projectiles to pass through the wall.

Yeah, you're definitely right about that! The fix we're working on should address more than just TF's W. :)

More than just TF's W?  Meaning skillshots in general are being addressed with Wind Wall?  Does...does this mean you're - **_gasp_**  - getting rid of it?? Is this an early peek at our Snowdown present??

Or am I being too hopeful again?
Thanks again! I'm glad you guys have found the time to look into this.
Please give {{champion:4}} some love. He is such a vulnerable champ and is no longer a healthy pick especially for competitive.
He is the best mid laner for Solo Queue in the game wtf.
no he is not, if you played him in solo Q you'd realise this.
I do, he's freelo.
he can't be more freelo than lux right now. Every game I've played this week with her on they enemy I've lost.... HARD.
You're right, Lux is pretty stupid too.

It is true, TF is like the best ever mid laner in season six right now... building on him is so easy. Laning is too easy as well. You don't even need the Doran's ring and your range is increased with the RFC and if you ult and w, its a free kill.

Teleporting isn't as strong as everyone makes it to be (Look at TSM when they vs. Impact). Yes he has good lock down potential but his playstyle is extremely binary and anyone champ with a gapcloser will crap on him if he doesn't have enough dmg to finish them off before they get to him.

Your best bet is to sercure kills on low health targets from across the map but it's not that hard to make no opportunities for him when playing against him.
Good.
Good
Good
So it can stop a tidal wave, but not a fucking card, one of the only things that a gust of wind would actually have some effect on?...
If underground shit and Vel'koz's knockup can get destroyed by Yasuo's windwall, then that's saying enough about how fucked up it is already. This really doesn't matter with that thought in mind...
Yeah i agree, there are definitely some inconsistencies (especially visually) when it comes to what Yasuo's W can and cant block.
good

Lmao

stop abusing cast time bugs and maybe this won't happen to you

Edit: No seriously. If this is considered a mechanical skill in League then this game deserves zero respect.

Hahahaa, I understand. It only goes through if yas uses his tornado through windwall. Serves you right Yas is beyond broken in anyone has more than 10 games with him and TF is vulnerable as hes right now so many things counter his stun. He needs some love!
No it can't my stun always gets blocked by this :/
I smell a small {{champion:157}} reworkk......

I see that every instance this bug occurs is when you use the Q+W animation/cast cancel. Is this a bug to be replicated on normal windwalls, or is it something that only occurs under the specific circumstances.

From that standpoint it could be concluded that if that bug only occurs under the animation cancel circumstances then it could be that the effect queues up AFTER the previous "cast time" had concluded, but the particle effect does not synchronize.

Yeah it can be easily replicated with the Q+W combo, however, iv'e definitely seen some projectiles (most notably TF's W) slip through my windwall immediately  after i cast it, not using the animation cancel.
You can block seven million ults in the game and you're complaining about something that is technically an auto attack, which you could avoid using your unlimited dashes?
I'm confused, how can Yasuo's E avoid an auto attack once it has been cast?
You're right it can't, but it could definitely get you a good enough distance away to counter play it.
